newsitem.title: LATVIA: Unibanka leads Latvian shares higher.
newsitem.headline: Unibanka leads Latvian shares higher.

text.p: Prices were stable to moderately higher on Tuesday and Unibanka was seen to be in for more gains after shareholders approved a eurobond issue, dealers said.
Total turnover on Tuesday rose to 73,000 lats from 63,000 lats and the Rietumu index added 1.05 percent to 183.8.
Unibanka was most active on volume of 34,000 lats and it rose to 3.40 lats from 3.36 lats.
"Unibanka's price could be seen gaining if the planned eurobond has a good rate," Leonid Ruderman, a dealer with the Parekss Bank, told Reuters.
Shareholders yesterday approved the issue of a eurobond, epected to be launched sometime in the summer. The size and maturity of the issue has not yet been decided.
Ruderman also saw a chance for higher profits for Unibanka if the long-term dollar resources are put to work cleverly.
"The bank has abundant lat resources and now it will be able to have more balance in terms of additional dollar resources," he added.

The decision of Unibanka's shareholders not to back a merger with Zemes Banka, which was expected, had little impact on the share but was seen as good news for Unibanka's price in the longer term, dealers said.
Elsewhere on the official list, stocks were mostly stable and the Riga Transport Fleet saw turnover of 11,300 lats but was stable at 1.22 lats.
Staburadze also remained stable at 1.22 lats amid increased demand as it saw a small 400 lats of shares traded.
"Staburadze posted a very good Q1 results earlier, when the bourse was in the lows and the market response was subdued," Ruderman said.
"We are now seeing the last phase of this reactian where the demand side dominates," he added.
Riga Shipyard added two santimes to 1.40 lats on volume of 8,400 lats.
